Peremption.definition: the absolute extinguishment of a right that prevents the bringing of an action [a claim barred by ] ;also
Peremption.origin: [Late Latin peremption- peremptio , the act of quashing, from Latin perimere to take away entirely, destroy, kill]

1.1: the absolute extinguishment of a right that prevents the bringing of an action [a claim barred by ]

2.1: the period of time after which such an extinguishment automatically occurs compare
